Detailed Description

Emuzed SW MP3 audio decoder interface class

Member Function Documentation

virtual ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::AllocateOutputBuffers (  UINT8 HUGE **&  out_buf_array,
UINT8 &  out_buf_count,
UINT32 &  out_buf_len,
DecodingFunctionType &  dec_fct
)  [virtual]
 

Allocates a number of output buffers that are used to store the decoded frames. The array will be freed (deallocated) when using StopAudioDecoder.

Parameters:
out_buf_array On return, a pointer to the output buffer array (the elements of the array are pointers to the actual buffers).
out_buf_count Desired number of buffers to be allocated in the output buffer array. If set to 0, the default number of buffers will be allocated. On return, the actual number of buffers, i.e. the AudioDecoder adapt the number passed in by the caller if necessary.
out_buf_len On return, the actual buffer length, i.e. the AudioDecoder.
dec_fct The caller informs the audio decoder about the function that it wants to be used for decoding (since the output buffers length and number depends on the decoding funtion). On return, contains the actually used value (e.g. if the desired decoding function is not supported).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
StopAudioDecoder

CodecDevice::ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::AllocateOutputBuffers (  UINT8 HUGE **&  out_buf_array,
UINT8 &  out_buf_count,
UINT32 &  out_buf_len,
DecodingFunctionType &  dec_fct
)  [virtual]
 

See also:
AudioDecoder::AllocateOutputBuffers

void EmzMp3Decoder::Close (   )  [virtual]
 

Closes and releases the audio decoder. This method should be invoked as soon as the audio decoder is not needed anymore to allow other audio decoders to access the resources.

See also:
Open

Implements AudioDecoder.

virtual ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::DecodeBuffer (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
const UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf,
UINT32  out_buf_len
)  [virtual]
 

Decodes an audio buffer. The input buffer shall contain at least one complete frame. This function continues decoding until there is no complete frame in the input buffer or not enough space in the output buffer. The actual decoding is done asynchronously, i.e., when the decoding process has finished, the callback function CbFrameDecoded will be invoked. Note: In the callback function the number of consumed bytes (of the input buffer) will be returned.

Parameters:
in_buf Pointer to the audio input buffer (containing the encoded frames).
in_buf_len Length of the audio input buffer (in bytes).
out_buf Pointer to the audio output buffer (containing the decoded frames).
out_buf_len Length of the audio output buffer (in bytes).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameDecoded

Implements AudioDecoder.

CodecDevice::ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::DecodeBuffer (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
const UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf,
UINT32  out_buf_len
)  [virtual]
 

See also:
AudioDecoder::DecodeBuffer

Implements AudioDecoder.

virtual ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::DecodeFrame (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
const UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf,
UINT32  out_buf_len
)  [virtual]
 

Decodes an audio frame. The input buffer contains always one complete frame. The actual decoding is done asynchronously, i.e., when the decoding process has finished, the callback function CbFrameDecoded will be invoked. Note: In the callback function the number of consumed bytes (of the input buffer) will be returned.
DecodeBuffer shall be preferred to this function.

Parameters:
in_buf Pointer to the audio input buffer (containing the encoded frame).
in_buf_len Length of the audio input buffer (in bytes).
out_buf Pointer to the audio output buffer (containing the decoded frame).
out_buf_len Length of the audio output buffer (in bytes).
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameDecoded

DecodeBuffer

Implements AudioDecoder.

CodecDevice::ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::GetCapabilities (  AudioCodecCapabilities &  caps  )  [virtual]
 

This function is used to retrieve the capabilities of the audio decoder (AudioDecoder sub-class).

Parameters:
caps On return, it contains the capabilities.
Note: The caller has to create this object (with arbitrary values) before calling this function. The passed object is then filled with the correct values by the AudioDecoder sub-class.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implements AudioDecoder.

See also:
AudioDecoder::GetCapabilities

virtual ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::GetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [virtual]
 

This function retrieves the values of specified parameters in the audio decoder.

Parameters:
types_array Array of the parameter types that specify the parameters to be retrieved.
values_array On return, array of the retrieved parameter values. The first element in this array is of type that is specified by the first element of types_array and so on. In general, the values themselves have to be casted to the actual parameter type. The caller has to allocate memory for this array before invoking of this function. The existing elements of the array are then filled with the corresponding parameter values by the audio decoder.
array_count Length (number of elements) of the types_array and types_array i.e., both arrays have always the same length.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecDevice::ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::GetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [virtual]
 

See also:

CodecDevice::ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::Open (   )  [virtual]
 

Opens the audio decoder. In general, when a decoder is opened, it is reserved for the caller and cannot be used by another caller. Thus, as soon as the audio decoder is not needed anymore, it shall be released by using Close.

Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
Close

Implements AudioDecoder.

virtual ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::RegisterCallbackFunctions (  void *  context,
CbFrameDecoded  cb_frame_decoded
)  [virtual]
 

Register callback functions.

Parameters:
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that is valid for all callback functions registered with this instance of the AudioDecoder. This context is then passed as an argument of all callback functions invoked by the AudioDecoder.
cb_frame_decoded A pointer to a callback function that is invoked by the AudioDecoder when a frame has been decoded (and post-processed) and is ready for rendering.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecDevice::ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::RegisterCallbackFunctions (  void *  context,
CbFrameDecoded  cb_frame_decoded
)  [virtual]

CodecDevice::ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::SetCodec (  CodecType  codec  )  [protected, virtual]

CodecDevice::SetCodec

CodecDevice::ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::SetConfig (  const UINT8 *  config_stream,
UINT32 &  config_len,
const AudioDecoderParameters &  params,
AudioStreamInfo &  stream_info
)  [virtual]
 

Configures the audio decoder.

Parameters:
config_stream Pointer to the configuration stream for audio decoder.
config_len Length of the configuration stream config_stream in number of bytes. On return it contains the number of bytes consumed.
params Audio decoder parameters. The parameter audio_codec indicates the audio codec (if known to the caller) that shall be used for decoding. If the audio codec is not known to the caller, this parameter shall be set to CodecManager::UnknownCodec or CodecManager::DefaultCodec and the AudioDecoder sub-class shall find out the appropriate codec (if supported). The same applies if the passed audio codec is not valid.
stream_info On return, it contains the encoded stream info.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implements AudioDecoder.

virtual ResultType EmzMp3Decoder::SetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
const UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [virtual]
 

Sets dynamically one or more decoder parameters.

Parameters:
types_array Array of the parameter types that specify the parameters to be changed. The corresponding values to be set are delivered in values_array.
values_array Array of the values to which the corresponding parameters have to be set. The first element in this array is of type that is specified by the first element of types_array and so on. In general, the values themselves have to be casted to the actual parameter type.
array_count Length (number of elements) of the types_array and values_array, i.e., both arrays have always the same length.
Returns:
Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

UINT8  array_count
)  [virtual]
